timeline.bodyText: is it current heap usage? if yes, what's the purpose to have this?
timeline.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText:
We will use this to decide which node has lowest load. The task will be distributed to node which

JVM heap usage not exceeds limitation(85%)
Executing AD task count is minimum and if there are multiple nodes has the same minimum task count, will choose one which has lower JVM heap usage.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText: but this is for stats requests, right? not sure how this JVM heap info is used after client receives it.
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText:
In next PR, the task manger will send AD stats transport action to get all data nodes' JVM heap info and executing task count to dispatch AD task.
The REST AD stats API is only for monitoring.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText: I see, thanks. our task manager will use the same one. MINOR: it's better to remove the jvm heap info from rest api since it's kind of confusing.
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

timeline.bodyText: I see it's only for testing. Is protected method good enough?
timeline.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: Yes, agree, will change to protected.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: We may have historical single and multiple entity detector, both will be counted as historical detector.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText: I will change this to historical single entity detector, so we can track historical single/multi-entity detector separately.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.bodyText: do we need realtime detector count?
timeline.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: This is for monitor usage, we can use this this to build some monitor/dashboard based on this. Currently our metrics shows only total detector count. Will add realtime detector count as well. But the old realtime detectors have no detector type filed, so we need to backfill these old detectors first if we want to get metrics for realtime single/multi-entity detector separately. Prefer to do that in another PR. Created an issue to track this: #333
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/src/main/java/com/amazon/opendistroforelasticsearch/ad/stats/StatNames.java b/src/main/java/com/amazon/opendistroforelasticsearch/ad/stats/StatNames.java
index a03bfcb..acc35a9 100644
--- a/src/main/java/com/amazon/opendistroforelasticsearch/ad/stats/StatNames.java
+++ b/src/main/java/com/amazon/opendistroforelasticsearch/ad/stats/StatNames.java

@@ -34,7 +34,7 @@ public enum StatNames {
     ANOMALY_DETECTION_STATE_STATUS("anomaly_detection_state_status"),
     MODEL_INFORMATION("models"),
     JVM_HEAP_USAGE("jvm_heap_usage"),
-    HISTORICAL_DETECTOR_COUNT("historical_detector_count"),
+    HISTORICAL_SINGLE_ENTITY_DETECTOR_COUNT("historical_single_entity_detector_count"),
     AD_EXECUTING_BATCH_TASK_COUNT("ad_executing_batch_task_count"),
     AD_CANCELED_BATCH_TASK_COUNT("ad_canceled_batch_task_count"),
     AD_TOTAL_BATCH_TASK_EXECUTION_COUNT("ad_total_batch_task_execution_count"),
